extendedIngredients.name: coconut aminos
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon coconut aminos (or salt, to taste)

extendedIngredients.name: mixed vegetables
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups finely chopped, assorted vegetables, such as carrot, celery, and mushrooms
metaInformation: such as carrot, celery, and mushrooms

recipes.title: Shrimp Egg Foo Young

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Tramin Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tramin Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Bright yellow in color with coppery reflections and clear fruit aromas of pear, citrus, honeysuckle, tropical fruits and light spices. Firm, velvety and rich on the palate, with well-integrated acidity. A very round and satisfying wine. Recommended with fish antipasti, risotto with asparagus, omelets and pasta

recipes.instructions: To make the sauce, pour the chicken stock into a small saucepan. Whisk in the toasted sesame oil, 1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper, dry sherry, and arrowroot powder. Heat the mixture over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until it has thickened. Remove from heat and set aside.In a medium mixing bowl whisk together the eggs, white pepper, garlic, and coconut aminos. Stir in the chopped vegetables, half of the green onions, and the shrimp.Place enough avocado oil in a skillet to completely coat the pan. Heat over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, spoon in a third of a cup of the egg mixture and let it brown well on one side. Flip carefully and brown the other side. Remove the cooked pancake to a plate and repeat until you have cooked all of the pancakes.To serve, place two of the pancakes on a plate and spoon on some of the sauce. Garnish with reserved green onions and serve.

steps.step: To make the sauce, pour the chicken stock into a small saucepan.
Whisk in the toasted sesame oil, 1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper, dry sherry, and arrowroot powder.
Heat the mixture over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until it has thickened.
Remove from heat and set aside.In a medium mixing bowl whisk together the eggs, white pepper, garlic, and coconut aminos. Stir in the chopped vegetables, half of the green onions, and the shrimp.
Place enough avocado oil in a skillet to completely coat the pan.
Heat over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, spoon in a third of a cup of the egg mixture and let it brown well on one side. Flip carefully and brown the other side.
Remove the cooked pancake to a plate and repeat until you have cooked all of the pancakes.To serve, place two of the pancakes on a plate and spoon on some of the sauce.
Garnish with reserved green onions and serve.
